I have checked out the APT classes from the 1.7 branch and created a JAR which I
have added to my Ant 1.6.5 lib directory. This allows me to execute an APT task
in Ant.

This works fine unless I have too many files. It allows up to around 250 to 320
files, but then fails. In normal mode I get no error message except for a
failure. In Ant debug mode (-d) I get the error below. I suspect this has to do
with the limit on the command line of 4k.

text:
I see it, there is a bug in AptExternalCompilerAdapter -it should group up all
source files and list them in an @response file if the command line length >4906
chars, but it wasnt.

Fix will be quick, hopefully

creator: bodewig@apache.org
